TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {38875=§ 2303 - Applicability of chapter, 40710=§ 2309 - Allocation of appropriations, 42733=§ 2324 - Allowable costs under defense contracts, 40908=§ 2311 - Assignment and delegation of procurement functions and responsibilities, 40603=§ 2308 - Buy-to-budget acquisition: end items, 41152=§ 2313 - Examination of records of contractor, 9683=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to strengthen protections against trafficking in persons in Federal contracts. These changes are intended to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13627, entitled “Strengthening Protections Against Trafficking in Persons in Federal Contracts,” and title XVII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013., 72875=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement a section of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2013 to include in the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), to the extent practicable, identification of any immediate owner or subsidiary, and all predecessors of an offeror that held a Federal contract or grant within the last three years. The objective is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the performance and integrity of the corporation before awarding a Federal contract., 42267=§ 2322 - Repealed., 42933=§ 2326 - Undefinitized contractual actions: restrictions, 42058=§ 2320 - Rights in technical data, 41779=§ 2317 - Repealed., 44302=§ 2336 - Intergovernmental support agreements with State and local governments, 38326=§ 2302 - Definitions, 43406=§ 2330 - Procurement of contract services: management structure, 44181=§ 2335 - Prohibition on collection of political information, 41955=§ 2319 - Encouragement of new competitors, 39831=§ 2305 - Contracts: planning, solicitation, evaluation, and award procedures, 44442=§ 2337 - Life-cycle management and product support, 38246=§ 2301 - Repealed., 40514=§ 2307 - Contract financing, 41050=§ 2312 - Remission of liquidated damages, 78339=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to further implement the inflation adjustment of acquisition-related dollar thresholds. A statute requires an adjustment every five years of acquisition-related thresholds for inflation using the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers, except for the Construction Wage Rate Requirements statute (Davis-Bacon Act), Service Contract Labor Standards statute, and trade agreements thresholds. DoD, GSA, and NASA are also proposing to use the same methodology to adjust nonstatutory FAR acquisition-related thresholds in 2015., 45585=Title 48 published on 2014-10-01, 43892=§ 2333 - Joint policies on requirements definition, contingency program management, and contingency contracting, 42153=§ 2321 - Validation of proprietary data restrictions, 41485=§ 2315 - Law inapplicable to the procurement of automatic data processing equipment and services for certain defense purposes, 40809=§ 2310 - Determinations and decisions, 42843=§ 2325 - Restructuring costs, 41672=§ 2316 - Disclosure of identity of contractor, 44065=§ 2334 - Independent cost estimation and cost analysis, 41376=§ 2314 - Laws inapplicable to agencies named in, 43051=§ 2327 - Contracts: consideration of national security objectives, 40075=§ 2306 - Kinds of contracts, 43326=§ 2329 - Repealed., 43650=§ 2331 - Procurement of services: contracts for professional and technical services, 4178=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to FAR Case 2013-001; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015., 41859=§ 2318 - Advocates for competition, 43178=§ 2328 - Release of technical data under Freedom of Information Act: recovery of costs, 39052=§ 2304 - Contracts: competition requirements, 42347=§ 2323 - Contract goal for small disadvantaged businesses and certain institutions of higher education, 43795=§ 2332 - Share-in-savings contracts}
